title: Directional diffusion models for graph representation learning. (arXiv:2306.13210v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: In recent years, diffusion models have achieved remarkable success in various domains of artificial intelligence, such as image synthesis, super-resolution, and 3D molecule generation. However, the application of diffusion models in graph learning has received relatively little attention. In this paper, we address this gap by investigating the use of diffusion models for unsupervised graph representation learning. We begin by identifying the anisotropic structures of graphs and a crucial limitation of the vanilla forward diffusion process in learning anisotropic structures. This process relies on continuously adding an isotropic Gaussian noise to the data, which may convert the anisotropic signals to noise too quickly. This rapid conversion hampers the training of denoising neural networks and impedes the acquisition of semantically meaningful representations in the reverse process. To address this challenge, we propose a new class of models called {\it directional diffusion models}. T

translated_abstract: 近年来，扩散模型在人工智能的各个领域中取得了显著的成功，例如图像合成、超分辨率和三维分子生成。然而，将扩散模型应用于图形学习方面却受到相对较少的关注。本文通过研究扩散模型在无监督图形表示学习中的应用，解决了这一空白。我们首先确认了图的各向异性结构和普通前向扩散过程在学习各向异性结构方面的关键局限性。这个过程依赖于将各向同性高斯噪声连续地添加到数据中，这可能会快速将各向异性信号转化为噪声。这种快速转化阻碍了去噪神经网络的训练，并阻碍了反向过程中获得语义有意义的表示。为了解决这一挑战，我们提出了一种新的模型类别——定向扩散模型。
tldr: 本文提出了定向扩散模型，解决了无监督图形表示学习中各向异性结构的挑战。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes directional diffusion models to address the challenge of anisotropic structures in unsupervised graph representation learning.
